content.content:
1→# alignment-hive
     2→
     3→Shared infrastructure for alignment researchers. [MATS](https://www.matsprogram.org/) scholars are the first intended users, but this is built for the broader AI safety community.
     4→
     5→Large orgs benefit from shared tooling and accumulated knowledge across their agents. This project aims to bring some of those advantages to independent researchers:
     6→
     7→- **Plugin marketplace** - Curated Claude Code plugins with skills for common research workflows
     8→- **hive-mind** - A system for sharing session learnings across the community (in development)
     9→
    10→## Installation
    11→
    12→### Prerequisites
    13→
    14→Install [Claude Code](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/overview) if you haven't already:
    15→```bash
    16→curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash
    17→```
    18→
    19→### Add the marketplace
    20→
    21→Run the following commands from within Claude Code (the `/` prefix indicates a Claude Code command):
    22→```
    23→/plugin marketplace add Crazytieguy/alignment-hive
    24→```
    25→
    26→Enable auto-update to get new plugins and updates automatically:
    27→1. Run `/plugin`
    28→2. Go to the **Marketplaces** tab
    29→3. Select **alignment-hive**
    30→4. Select **Enable auto-update**
    31→
    32→Install the mats plugin (recommended for MATS scholars):
    33→```
    34→/plugin install mats@alignment-hive
    35→```
    36→
    37→The mats plugin includes:
    38→- **project-setup** - Guidance for starting new projects with good architecture decisions
    39→- **fellow-handbook** - Quick lookup of MATS policies, compute access, housing, and program logistics
    40→
    41→Also available:
    42→```
    43→/plugin install llms-fetch-mcp@alignment-hive
    44→```
    45→
    46→Adds an MCP server for fetching documentation with [llms.txt](https://llmstxt.org/) support.
    47→
    48→## Contributing
    49→
    50→The [plugin-dev](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code-plugins) plugin auto-installs when you clone this repo, so Claude can help with plugin development.
    51→
    52→Feedback and suggestions welcome—open an issue, send a Slack DM, or reach out however works for you. All changes go through PR review.
    53→
    54→## Web App
    55→
    56→A web interface for hive-mind is in development at [alignment-hive.com](https://alignment-hive.com).
    57→
    58→## Roadmap
    59→
    60→See [docs/roadmap.md](docs/roadmap.md) for what's planned.
    61→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.content:
1→# alignment-hive
     2→
     3→Claude Code infrastructure for AI safety researchers.
     4→
     5→## About This Repo
     6→
     7→@README.md explains what this is. Keep it up to date as the project evolves.
     8→
     9→This is a **bun monorepo**:
    10→- `web/` - TanStack Start web app (alignment-hive.com)
    11→- `hive-mind/` - CLI for session extraction
    12→- `plugins/` - Plugin distributions
    13→
    14→## Working on the Code
    15→
    16→**For web app**: Read [web/README.md](web/README.md) for local development setup
    17→
    18→**For CLI**: Read [hive-mind/CLAUDE.md](hive-mind/CLAUDE.md) for development guidelines
    19→
    20→## Plugin Versioning
    21→
    22→When updating plugin content (skills, commands, hooks, etc.), you must bump the version in `plugin.json` for users to receive the update. The auto-update system compares installed versions with marketplace versions - without a version bump, changes won't propagate to users.
    23→
    24→## Python
    25→
    26→Use [uv](https://docs.astral.sh/uv/) with inline dependencies (PEP 723). Run scripts with `uv run script.py`.
    27→
    28→## hive-mind Session Files
    29→
    30→The `.claude/hive-mind/sessions/` directory contains extracted session data. These files **should be committed** - they're test fixtures and development data for hive-mind.
    31→
    32→However, **do not read or search these files** during normal development. They contain long conversation logs that will spam your context. Only access them when specifically working on session extraction or formatting.

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

```bash
cd ~/my-project && claude
```

Works for both new and existing projects.

add /exit step before navigating to project directory. Also document

)"
